pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:0.5.eng: The training rule on married girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.2.eng: the nuns were giving the full admission to married girls less than twelve years old.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.3.pli: Tā akkhamā honti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.3.eng: They were unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.4.pli: Uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātikā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.4.eng: and they were unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.6.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to married girls less than twelve years old?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.11.pli: Ūnadvādasavassā, bhikkhave, gihigatā akkhamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.11.eng: A married girl less than twelve years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.12.pli: Uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātikā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.12.eng: and she’s unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.13.pli: Dvādasavassāva kho, bhikkhave, gihigatā khamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.13.eng: But a married girl who is twelve years old is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.14.pli: Uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātikā hoti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.16.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.17.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is less than twelve years old, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.5.eng: Who is less than twelve years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.6.eng: who has not reached twelve years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.7.comm: For the rendering of gihigatā as “married girl”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.8.eng: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.11.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.11.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.12.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.12.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.13.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.14.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.15.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.15.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.1.eng: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as less, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.2.eng: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun is unsure of it, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.3.eng: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as more, and she gives her the full admission, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.4.eng: If the girl is more than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as less, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.5.eng: If the girl is more than twelve years old, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.6.eng: If the girl is more than twelve years old, and the nun perceives her as more, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.2.eng: if she gives the full admission to a girl less than twelve years old, but she perceives her as more;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.3.eng: if she gives the full admission to a girl more than twelve years old, and she perceives her as more;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.6.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:0.5.eng: The second training rule on married girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to married girls who were more than twelve years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.3.pli: Tā bālā honti abyattā na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.3.eng: They were ignorant and incompetent, and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.5.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to married girls who are more than twelve years old, but who haven’t trained for two years in the six rules?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.11.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.11.eng: After rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.12.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.12.eng: “Monks, approval is required for a married girl who is more than twelve years old to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.13.eng: And the approval is to be given like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.14.pli: Tāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.14.eng: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that married girl who is more than twelve years old should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.15.pli: ‘ahaṃ, ayye, itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.15.eng: ‘Venerables, I, so-and-so, a married girl who is more than twelve years old, am training under Venerable so-and-so. I ask the Sangha for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.16.eng: And she should ask a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.18.eng: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.19.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.20.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.20.eng: The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.21.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.21.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.23.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.24.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.24.eng: The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.25.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.25.eng: The Sangha gives approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.26.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiyā dānaṃ, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.26.eng: Any nun who approves of giving approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.27.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.28.pli: Dinnā saṅghena itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammuti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.28.eng: The Sangha has given approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.29.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.29.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.30.pli: Sā paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā evaṃ vadehīti vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.30.eng: That married girl, who is more than twelve years old, should be told to say this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.31.pli: “pāṇātipātā veramaṇiṃ dve vassāni avītikkamma samādānaṃ samādiyāmi …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.31.eng: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression. …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.32.pli: vikālabhojanā veramaṇiṃ dve vassāni avītikkamma samādānaṃ samādiyāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.32.eng: I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.33.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.33.eng: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.34.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.34.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.35.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.35.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old, but who has not trained in the six rules for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.5.eng: Who is more than twelve years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.6.eng: who has reached twelve years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.8.eng: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.12.pli: sikkhā vā na dinnā hoti, dinnā vā sikkhā kupitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.12.eng: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.15.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.15.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.16.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.16.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.17.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.18.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.19.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.19.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.20.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.21.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.22.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.23.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.24.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.25.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.27.pli: paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.27.eng: if she gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained in the six rules for two years;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.29.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.30.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:0.5.eng: The third training rule on married girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to married girls who were more than twelve years old and who had trained in the six rules for two years, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.4.pli: “etha, sikkhamānā, imaṃ jānātha, imaṃ detha, imaṃ āharatha, iminā attho, imaṃ kappiyaṃ karothā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.4.eng: “Come, trainee nuns, find out about this,” “Give this,” “Bring this,” “There’s need for this,” or “Make this allowable.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.6.eng: “Venerables, we’re not trainee nuns. We’re nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.8.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to married girls who are more than twelve years old and who have trained for two years in the six rules, but who haven’t been approved by the Sangha?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.15.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.16.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.16.eng: “Monks, approval should be given for the full admission of a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.17.eng: And it should be given like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.18.pli: Tāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.18.eng: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that married girl who is more than twelve years old should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.19.pli: ‘ahaṃ, ayye, itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā, saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.19.eng: ‘Venerables, I, the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, ask the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.20.eng: And she should ask a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.22.eng: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.23.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.24.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.24.eng: This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.25.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.25.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.27.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.28.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassā gihigatā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.28.eng: This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.29.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.29.eng: The Sangha gives approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.30.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiyā dānaṃ, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.30.eng: Any nun who approves of giving approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.31.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.32.pli: Dinnā saṅghena itthannāmāya paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya gihigatāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammuti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.32.eng: The Sangha has given approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.33.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.33.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.34.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.34.eng: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.35.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.35.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.36.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:1.36.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.5.eng: Who is more than twelve years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.6.eng: who has reached twelve years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.8.eng: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.12.eng: who has trained in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.14.pli: ñattidutiyena kammena vuṭṭhānasammuti na dinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.14.eng: approval to be fully admitted has not been given though a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.17.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.17.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.18.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.18.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.19.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.20.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.21.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.21.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.22.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.23.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.24.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.25.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.26.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.27.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.29.pli: paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.29.eng: if she gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained in the six rules for two years and who has been approved by the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.31.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc67:2.32.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.
